newsitem.title: USA: Nasdaq stocks close slightly lower.
newsitem.headline: Nasdaq stocks close slightly lower.

text.p: Another steady performance by the high techs failed to offest the downward pull of a weak bond market and lift Nasdaq into positive territory.
The Nasdaq Composite Index was off 0.93, or 0.08 percent, at 1143.03 at its unofficial close. Advances inched ahead of declining issues on volume of about 443 million shares.
"Again technology is acting reasonably well given the bond market selloff," said Ralph Bloch, chief technical analyst at Raymond James.

Atmel Corp, which topped the over-the-counter most active list, was up one at 25-7/8. Shares rebounded in heavy trading as investors scurried to cover short positions, said Kris Chellam, the company's chief financial officer.

C-Cube Microsystems Inc was up 3-3/8 at 33-3/4 on the possibility that the maker of semiconductor-based encorders could get some of Zenith Electronics Corp's $1 billion contract for supplying digital TV set-top boxes to the Americast consortium.
Novell Inc was down 3/4 at 11-1/8 after Dean Witter cut its rating on the stock to accumulate from buy.
